alert.note: Alert for Luzerne (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 16 at 1:35AM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Luzerne. * WHEN...Until 330 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain fell earlier this evening, and an additional 1 inch of rain is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hazleton, West Hazleton, Freeland, Conyngham, Nescopeck, Slocum, White Haven, Shickshinny, Drums, Mountain Top, Drifton, Woodside-Drifton, Pond Hill, Beach Haven, Rock Glen, East Berwick, Dorrance, Penn Lake Park, Jeddo and Sybertsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
